translator_notes: 「红楼梦」literally means 'Dream of the Red Chamber' - red chambers (红楼) historically referred to the painted chambers where noble women resided
「脂砚斋」(Zhiyan Zhai, 'Rouge Inkstone Studio') is the pen name of the primary commentator, believed to be someone close to Cao Xueqin, possibly a female relative
「汇校本」indicates this is a collation of multiple manuscript sources (甲戌本, 庚辰本, 己卯本, etc.) with their various commentaries
The cover illustration likely depicts Lin Daiyu (林黛玉) or represents the archetype of the refined beauty central to the novel's themes
research_notes: This edition is compiled by Kolistan based on the 抚琴居红楼梦文学社区 (Fuqinju Dream of Red Chamber Literary Community)
The 脂评汇校本 is a scholarly edition that preserves the original 80-chapter Cao Xueqin text with Zhiping marginalia from various manuscript traditions
